title: Adrian Brown (baseball)
text:
Adrian Demond Brown (born February 7, 1974) is an American former professional baseball <a href="outfielder">outfielder</a> who played from 1997 through 2006 in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB). Brown is a <a href="switch-hitter">switch-hitter</a> and throws <a href="right-handed">right-handed</a>.
Brown has the ability to play all three outfield positions, mainly <a href="center%20fielder">center field</a>. He reached the MLB in 1997 with the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Pirates">Pittsburgh Pirates</a>, spending six years with them before moving to the <a href="Boston%20Red%20Sox">Boston Red Sox</a> (2003) <a href="Kansas%20City%20Royals">Kansas City Royals</a> (2004), and <a href="Texas%20Rangers%20%28baseball%29">Texas Rangers</a> (2006). His most productive season came in 2000 with Pittsburgh, when he posted career-highs in <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">batting average</a> (.315), <a href="home%20run">home run</a>s (4), <a href="Run%20batted%20in">RBI</a> (28), <a href="Run%20%28baseball%29">runs</a> (64), <a href="Double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a> (18), and <a href="stolen%20base">stolen base</a>s (13) in 104 <a href="games%20played">games</a>.
